steps.title: Where to find the website pages
steps.content: Let’s check where the inbuild pages are located.

steps.title: Navigate to the 'Content' section
steps.content: In the top bar, locate and click on the 'Content' section.

steps.title: Go to the 'Home' or any other page
steps.content: On the left-hand side, you will see the content node tree, click on the 'Home' page or any other to open the existing page.

steps.title: View the content of the page
steps.content: The ByteEditor allows you to design the page in the admin panel and present it to the final user by clicking on the 'Save and Publish' button.

steps.title: How to add your first 'Page'
steps.content: Let's add your first new 'Page' to your site.

steps.title: Navigate to the 'Content' section
steps.content: In the top bar, locate and click on the 'Content' section.

steps.title: Locate the parent of your new page
steps.content: In this example, the parent will be the 'Home' page, however, you can create a page under any other page in the content tree. When you hover over the 'Home' page in the content tree you will see this icon '...'

steps.title: Create a new 'Page'
steps.content: From the list, choose 'Block Grid'

steps.title: Name your 'Page'
steps.content: In the field at the top, enter a name for your new 'Page'. This name will be used in the URL to access the page on the front end of your site.

steps.title: Save and Publish
steps.content: Once you are happy with the changes, in the bottom right of the screen, hit 'Save and Publish'. Your updates are now live on your site! :-)

steps.title: How to add the layout to the page
steps.content: Let’s fill your page with the content

steps.title: Navigate to the 'Content' section
steps.content: In the top bar, locate and click on the 'Content' section.

steps.title: Go to your new page or any prebuilt page
steps.content: On the left-hand side, you will see the content node tree, click on the 'Home' page or any other to open the existing page.

steps.title: Add the layout
steps.content: Click the 'Add Layout' button to open the Layouts gallery.

steps.title: Layouts Menu
steps.content:
The Layouts are the empty blocks with different column weights that can be filled with the content blocks to create a unique design for your page.

The Ready Layout Blocks are the sections with the sets of content blocks. Fill in the needed information, and get the result in a few seconds.
steps.element: #umbracoMainPageBody > umb-backoffice-icon-registry > div.umb-editors > div > div.scoped-view > ng-form > div > div

steps.title: Style the Layout
steps.content: The Layout can be styled in different ways. Choose the background picture or color to get your unique design.

steps.title: Add the Layout to your design
steps.content: Press the 'Create' button to place the Layout on the page.

steps.title: How to add the content to the page
steps.content: Let’s fill your page with the content

steps.title: Navigate to the 'Content' section
steps.content: In the top bar, locate and click on the 'Content' section.

steps.title: Go to your new page or any prebuilt page
steps.content: On the left-hand side, you will see the content node tree, click on the 'Home' page or any other to open the existing page.

steps.title: Add the layout
steps.content: Click the 'Add Layout' button to open the Layouts gallery.

steps.title: Layouts Menu
steps.content: Choose the Layout from the list. For example 'One Column Layout'
steps.element: #umbracoMainPageBody > umb-backoffice-icon-registry > div.umb-editors > div > div.scoped-view > ng-form > div > div

steps.title: Style the Layout
steps.content: The Layout can be styled in different ways. Choose the background picture or color to get your unique design and click Create.

steps.title: Add content to the layout
steps.content: Click the 'Add Content' button to open the Elements gallery.

steps.title: Elements Menu
steps.content: Choose the Element from the list. For example 'Call to Action' to add the button to your design.

steps.title: Fill in needed information
steps.content: Fill in the properties to add the element to the design.

steps.title: Add the element to your design
steps.content: Press the 'Create' button to place the element on the page.

steps.title: How to edit the content to the page
steps.content: Let’s edit your page with the content

steps.title: Navigate to the 'Content' section
steps.content: In the top bar, locate and click on the 'Content' section.

steps.title: Go to any prebuilt page with content
steps.content: On the left-hand side, locate the 'Home' node in the content tree. Click on the 'Home' page or any prebuilt page with content to open and start editing

steps.title: Edit content in the 'Content' section
steps.content:
All pages are made up of layouts. You can find layouts with added content in the 'Content' section.

Take some time to add, edit and reorder content.

steps.title: Save and Publish
steps.content: Once you are happy with the changes, in the bottom right of the screen, hit 'Save and Publish'. Your updates are now live on your site! :-)

steps.title: How to copy content to the page
steps.content: Let’s fill your page with the content

steps.title: Navigate to the 'Content' section
steps.content: In the top bar, locate and click on the 'Content' section.

steps.title: Go to any prebuilt page with content
steps.content: On the left-hand side, locate the 'Home' node in the content tree. Click on the 'Home' page or any prebuilt page with content to open and start editing

steps.title: Copy the content or layout on your page
steps.content: Hovering over the layout or content, you will see a 'copy' icon, click on the 'copy' icon.

steps.title: Add content to the layout
steps.content: Click the 'Add Content' button to open the Elements gallery.

steps.title: Open the Clipboard
steps.content: Сlick the 'Clipboard' button to see the previously copied content.

steps.title: Clipboard Menu
steps.content: Choose the Element from the list.

steps.title: Save and Publish
steps.content: Once you are happy with the changes, in the bottom right of the screen, hit 'Save and Publish'. Your updates are now live on your site! :-)
